qas.question: What was the nickname of Bill Robinson?
Near what park is the monument dedicated to the person traditionally regarded as discovering America?
How many bells are contained in the World War I Memorial Carillon?
The dead of what war were the first to be commemorated by the Virginia War Memorial?
In what neighborhood is the monument to Bill Robinson located?

context: The city is home to many monuments and memorials, most notably those along Monument Avenue. Other monuments include the A.P. Hill monument, the Bill "<a0_0>Bojangles<a0_0/>" Robinson monument in <a4_0>Jackson Ward<a4_0/>, the Christopher Columbus monument near <a1_0>Byrd<a1_0/> Park, and the Confederate Soldiers and Sailors Monument on Libby Hill. Located near Byrd Park is the famous World War I Memorial Carillon, a <a2_0>56<a2_0/>-bell carillon tower. Dedicated in 1956, the Virginia War Memorial is located on Belvedere overlooking the river, and is a monument to Virginians who died in battle in <a3_0>World War II<a3_0/>, the Korean War, the Vietnam War, the Gulf War, the War in Afghanistan, and the Iraq War.
